page.title: 09LOCAL PLACE OF INTEREST
page.content: A FAMOUS LANDMARK IN THE LOCALITY IS {THE PARC AND DARE HALL AND INSTITUTE. THE INSTITUTE AND LIBRARY WAS{BUILT IN {1903 FINANCED BY THE MINERS}OF THE AREA.IN 1913 THE THEATRE WAS BUILT, BEING USED TO SHOW SILENT MOVIES.IN 1974 IT WAS DONATED TO THE RHONDDA BOROUGH COUNCIL,WHO RENOVATED IT. AS THE ONLY THEATRE IN THE RHONDDA, IT PRESENTLY SERVES THE COMMUNITY IN A VARIETY OF WAYS.THERE IS A SNOOKER ROOM,A DOCTOR'S SURGERY,ALSO A LOUNGE BAR RESERVED FOR SPECIAL FUNCTIONS.THE THEATRE IS USED BY VARIOUS THEATRICAL GROUPS,LOCAL AND TRAVELLING OPERATIC SOCIETIES,CHORAL SOCIETIES,BRASS BANDS AND ORCHESTRAS.RHONDDA ARTS AND DANCE WORKSHOPS ARE BASED HERE, WHILST THE MODEL RAILWAY CLUB AND ART SOCIETY ALSO HOLD THEIR MEETINGS HERE. IT ALSO SHOWS FILMS WEEKLY,THUS PROVIDING THE COMMUNITY WITH A VARIED PROGRAMME.
